verdict.summary: http.ErrServerClosed is returned by ListenAndServe after Shutdown() or Close() is called. This is expected behavior during graceful shutdown but confusing when treated as an unexpected error.

dead_ends.action: Wrap ListenAndServe in a retry loop
dead_ends.why_fails: After Shutdown/Close, the server cannot be restarted â€” retrying ListenAndServe on a closed server will fail immediately again

workarounds.action: Check for http.ErrServerClosed and treat it as a normal shutdown
Implement graceful shutdown with signal handling
workarounds.how:
quit := make(chan os.Signal, 1)
signal.Notify(quit, syscall.SIGINT, syscall.SIGTERM)
<-quit
ctx, cancel := context.WithTimeout(context.Background(), 30*time.Second)
defer cancel()
srv.Shutdown(ctx)

leads_to.condition: when shutdown cancels in-flight request contexts

preceded_by.condition: when file descriptor exhaustion forces server shutdown

frequently_confused_with.distinction: 'Server closed' means the server was intentionally shut down, while 'connection refused' means the server is not listening on the port at all.
